Package manito.eft.interfaces

Class DeviceRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • manito.eft.interfaces.DeviceRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DeviceEvent
    public class DeviceRequest
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    Entity class for holding details of a device proxy request made (in either direction) between POS and terminal/core.

    • Method Detail

      • getAction

        public int getAction()
        Get the action requested.

        Supported operations: 

           DISPLAY                  simple display at the POS
   DISPLAY_ACKNOWLEDGE      display at the POS with acknowledgement
   DISPLAY_YES_NO           display at the POS with yes/no response
   DISPLAY_MENU             display at the POS with a menu selection
   DISPLAY_KEYBOARD         display at the POS with a keyboard for full alphanumeric response
   DISPLAY_KEYPAD           display at the POS with a keypad for numeric entry
   READ_CARD                read card details from the POS MSR
   READ_CHEQUE              read cheque details from the POS MCIR
   PRINT                    print printer
   PRINTER_STATUS           get the status of the POS printer
   EVENT                    dummy action for event reporting
   PINPAD_DISPLAY           display to the customer via the pinpad
   PINPAD_INPUT             request predefined input from the customer via the pinpad
   AUTHORITY_CHECK          request an authority/privilege level check
        Returns:
        action

      • setAction

        public void setAction​(int action)
        Set the action requested.

        Supported operations: 

           DISPLAY                  simple display at the POS
   DISPLAY_ACKNOWLEDGE      display at the POS with acknowledgement
   DISPLAY_YES_NO           display at the POS with yes/no response
   DISPLAY_MENU             display at the POS with a menu selection
   DISPLAY_KEYBOARD         display at the POS with a keyboard for full alphanumeric response
   DISPLAY_KEYPAD           display at the POS with a keypad for numeric entry
   READ_CARD                read card details from the POS MSR
   READ_CHEQUE              read cheque details from the POS MCIR
   PRINT                    print printer
   PRINTER_STATUS           get the status of the POS printer
   EVENT                    dummy action for event reporting
   PINPAD_DISPLAY           display to the customer via the pinpad
   PINPAD_INPUT             request predefined input from the customer via the pinpad
   AUTHORITY_CHECK          request an authority/privilege level check
        Parameters:
        action - the action

      • isBackground

        public boolean isBackground()
        Get the flag for whether "background" processing has requested. If set, the POS will not be able to process device access requests. Applies to Channel 2 requests only.
        Returns:
        background

      • setBackground

        public void setBackground​(boolean background)
        Set the flag for whether "background" processing has requested. If set, the POS will not be able to process device access requests. Applies to Channel 2 requests only.
        Parameters:
        background - the background

      • getPinpadInputList

        public PinpadInput[] getPinpadInputList()
        Get the set of input details requested.
        Returns:
        pinpadInputList

      • setPinpadInputList

        public void setPinpadInputList​(PinpadInput[] pinpadInputList)
        Set the set of input details requested.
        Parameters:
        pinpadInputList - the pinpadInputList

      • getControlOptions

        public int[] getControlOptions()
        Get the set of control options to extend the default display set.

        Supported control options: 

           ABORT_TRANSACTION        transaction-level abort enabled (AbortRequest on channel 0)
   NO_ABORT_TRANSACTION     transaction-level abort disabled
   CANCEL_DIALOG            general dialog-level cancel enabled
   NO_CANCEL_DIALOG         general dialog-level cancel disabled
   CANCEL_BACK              dialog-level cancel to go back to previous input screen
   CANCEL_FORWARD           dialog-level cancel to go forward to the next input screen
        If neither of ABORT_TRANSACTION or NO_ABORT_TRANSACTION is specified, the POS should adopt the default core CapCancellation setting.

        If neither of CANCEL_DIALOG or NO_CANCEL_DIALOG is specified, the POS should adopt a suitable default based on the Forced setting and the Action requested.

        Returns:
        controlOptions

      • setControlOptions

        public void setControlOptions​(int[] controlOptions)
        Set the set of control options to extend the default display set.

        Supported control options: 

           ABORT_TRANSACTION        transaction-level abort enabled (AbortRequest on channel 0)
   NO_ABORT_TRANSACTION     transaction-level abort disabled
   CANCEL_DIALOG            general dialog-level cancel enabled
   NO_CANCEL_DIALOG         general dialog-level cancel disabled
   CANCEL_BACK              dialog-level cancel to go back to previous input screen
   CANCEL_FORWARD           dialog-level cancel to go forward to the next input screen
        If neither of ABORT_TRANSACTION or NO_ABORT_TRANSACTION is specified, the POS should adopt the default core CapCancellation setting.

        If neither of CANCEL_DIALOG or NO_CANCEL_DIALOG is specified, the POS should adopt a suitable default based on the Forced setting and the Action requested.

        Parameters:
        controlOptions - the controlOptions

      • getTarget

        public int getTarget()
        Get the Target for action.

        Supported target environments/devices: 

           POS                      operator interaction at POS
   TERMINAL                 customer interaction at pinpad/terminal
   PRINTER                  POS printer
   CARD_READER              card reader either on POS or via designated core
   CHEQUE_READER            cheque reader either on POS or via designated core
        Returns:
        target

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget​(int target)
        Set the Target for action.

        Supported target environments/devices: 

           POS                      operator interaction at POS
   TERMINAL                 customer interaction at pinpad/terminal
   PRINTER                  POS printer
   CARD_READER              card reader either on POS or via designated core
   CHEQUE_READER            cheque reader either on POS or via designated core
        Parameters:
        target - the target

      • isMultiInput

        public boolean isMultiInput()
        Get whether input is to be allowed from any available input source - keyboard/BCR/MSR etc.

        e.g. to allow loyalty id to be entered by swipe/scan as well as by manual keying.

        Returns:
        multiInput

      • setMultiInput

        public void setMultiInput​(boolean multiInput)
        Set whether input is to be allowed from any available input source - keyboard/BCR/MSR etc.

        e.g. to allow loyalty id to be entered by swipe/scan as well as by manual keying.

        Parameters:
        multiInput - the multiInput

      • getSignature

        public Point[] getSignature()
        Get the signature if captured electronically.

        An array of (x, y) coordinate points. A special point value is (-1, -1) which indicates the end of a line (pen lift). Most all signatures consist of more than one line.

        Returns:
        signature

      • setSignature

        public void setSignature​(Point[] signature)
        Set the signature if captured electronically.

        An array of (x, y) coordinate points. A special point value is (-1, -1) which indicates the end of a line (pen lift). Most all signatures consist of more than one line.

        Parameters:
        signature - the signature
